newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Radio Ireland announces schedule, presenters.
newsitem.headline: Radio Ireland announces schedule, presenters.

text.p: Ireland's newest radio station, Radio Ireland, on Tuesday announced details of its weekday programme schedule and its team of presenters.
The new station, which will begin broadcasting on March 17, aims to provide listeners with an alternative to Irish national radio, RTE.

Its said its team of presenters would include sports commentators Eamon Dunphy and John Giles, the political editor of Ireland's Sunday Business, Post Emily O'Reilly, and Sunday Tribune writer Ann Marie Hourihane.
"We are happy that we have found a distinctive blend of talent that will provide our listeners with a real alternative," Radio Ireland chairman John Colgan said in a statement.
